page.title: 11HUNTING ETC.AROUND DUNSFORD.
page.content: This area and others around it were in the past owned by local squires.The land was used for farming but the owner retained hunting,shooting and fishing rights.These activities still give pleasure to many people. The local foxhunt meets and there are other hunts.Shoots for pheasants are organised and there is fishing in the River Teign.Pheasants are bred then set free but rabbits,hares,foxes and deer breed naturally and take their food from the wild but occasionally when their natural food is scarce they will spoil crops or kill stock.Some form of control then becomes necessary A local farmer whose land adjoins an area of woodland said "I like deer. They do little damage but when the numbers increase and they become a nuisance we enjoy a joint of vension."
